metadata.name: screenshot-to-code
metadata.description: Drop in a screenshot and convert it to clean code (HTML/Tailwind/React/Vue)

issues.title: Error generating code. Check the Developer Console AND the backend logs for details. Feel free to open a Github issue.
issues.body:
After clicking "update", two Error generating code were prompted. Check the Developer Console AND the backend logs for details. Feel free to open a Github issue.
1. I confirmed that my apikey can use gpt-4-vision-preview
2. I ran it through docker-compose and first ran echo "OPENAI_API_KEY=my-api-key" > .env in the root directory
3. After my docker is started, http://localhost:5173 can be accessed normally.
4.When accessing http://localhost:7001, it prompts {"detail":"Not Found"}
5. There is no response or change in the console during "update".
![1701068348892](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/55eef798-68c0-474f-81a6-cc49098855d6)
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/d42e5758-db92-4440-a73e-9a1154a3d0cb)

comments_data.body: I was same the tips error.

Your steps look correct. Going to / on backend is supposed to give that message. 

After you drag and drop an image on the front end page, can you share your browser console as well as your docker logs?

First thing to debug is if it's connecting properly to the backend so I would insert some logs at the top of the websocket code.
same issue and the logs in the terminal are:

Since I'm not very familiar with the web, could you tell me how to check if the backend starts normally.
In addition, how to determine the effective connection between the front end and the back end?
@tiefengsun i will add better logging to the code today. You can pull and try again.
OK Thank you very much, I will give you feedback later.
> same issue and the logs in the terminal are: > Do you need any information? I did every step as the instructions you give without using docker @abi
@sezermzgl looking at your logs, it looks the first generation did work? Did the error happened when you tried to do a follow up?

> After clicking "update", two Error generating code were prompted. Check the Developer Console AND the backend logs for details. Feel free to open a Github issue.
> 
> 1. I confirmed that my apikey can use gpt-4-vision-preview
> 2. I ran it through docker-compose and first ran echo "OPENAI_API_KEY=my-api-key" > .env in the root directory
> 3. After my docker is started, http://localhost:5173 can be accessed normally.
>    4.When accessing http://localhost:7001, it prompts {"detail":"Not Found"}
> 4. There is no response or change in the console during "update".
>    ![1701068348892](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/52314569/285750625-55eef798-68c0-474f-81a6-cc49098855d6.jpg?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..pnkQJXbZbBVcLys6AFO5RGOSsaCDMM1s0-vzqT-i_eY)
>    ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/52314569/285750698-d42e5758-db92-4440-a73e-9a1154a3d0cb.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..JVkVKJddioKWn0pEKYnNppkTTw3hrEmEWJA4SRLUfVY)

I have the same error
i found that you have to load money in your openia account, it is already prepaid, so you have to recharge the balance for your api to work.
@vicman I don't think so. I used the same apikey yesterday and it worked at https://picoapps.xyz/free-tools/screenshot-to-code, but when I built it through docker compose, I got this error.

> @tiefengsun i will add better logging to the code today. You can pull and try again.
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/9928cdbf-115f-4c43-b4ab-2860507390a1)
After pulling the image again, the problem remains. Here are the docker logs for both containers.
There is no relevant error message in the update after uploading the image? How should I enter the front\backend to check the operation status?

@abi This is the console information of chrome after clicking "update"
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/a6ba3226-d476-489d-b8b6-b167259fa283)
and docker logs?

![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/f824918e-824e-49d7-b871-52336de86dfd)
My operations have no log updates in docker

Try adding this line to frontend/.env.local:

VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL=wss://172.19.0.3:7001
I think the issue might be that your front-end is not connecting to the backend at all

![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/86dce0eb-4a56-45a9-9a41-37116ae485b0)
Modified .env.local under /screenshot-to-code/frontend
. The content is VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL=ws://172.19.0.3:7001. The problem still occurs.

The real IP I tried to access: 7001 prompted the error below.
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/c5c6ad55-35f3-4a30-922d-7d7196079a78)
The docker log on the backend will show the following error:
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/52314569/272f99e5-fefb-442a-85aa-4ca638349a91)

INFO: Application startup complete. INFO: 127.0.0.1:62170 - "GET / HTTP/1.1" 404 Not Found

You can fix that following @abi suggestion. Inside the frontend there is a file called .env.example. Duplicate it and rename to .env only. Should work.
same issue here, the .env file would only take ws or wss url. the backend log shows http://127.0.0.1:7000/ url, what's the fix here or what should put inside .env file?
it needs just a WS URL: VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL=ws://your address

> When you go to the backend url in the browser, what do you see?

Your backend is running correctly. Please open the front-end URL (default is http://localhost:5173) to use screenshot-to-code.

Ok, this worked for me:

```
cd backend
mkdir backend # yes, inside backend
mv *.py backend/
poetry install
poetry shell
cd backend # yes, backend/backend
poetry run uvicorn main:app --reload --port 7000
```

And `frontend` stuff stays the same.

I suppose an easier solution would be to do `mv pyproject.toml ../`
@vfonic I can see why that works. Python has weird import mechanisms for the root of the project. Glad it worked for you!
Added some info to the FAQs.

def convert_frontend_str_to_llm(frontend_str: str) -> Llm:

comments_data.body: We're definitely interested in adding Ollama support to this project. Thanks for opening this issue.
I'm also looking forward to this feature! ✨
Yeah, it will would great to support ollama, LM studio, llama.cpp and more well-known opensource LLMs, like MiniCPM for vision.
![16548AB1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/067d23d7-93b4-43c2-a632-3fc840ca3003)
how's it going now?

Ollama already has a OpenAI-compatible API, so all you have to do is change the env variable and create model aliases.

Add to `backend/.env`
```
export OPENAI_BASE_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1"
export OPENAI_API_KEY=fake-key
```

Then create aliases for the models that screenshot-to-code-uses
```
for model in \
   claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620 \
   gpt-4o-2024-05-13 \
   gpt-4-turbo-2024-04-09 \
   gpt_4_vision \
   claude_3_sonnet; do
   ollama cp x/llama3.2-vision $model
done
```

Then it will call your local models when it makes LLM requests. Change  `x/llama3.2-vision` to whatever model you want. 

I've not gotten very good success because all I can run is a 13b model but perhaps the more powerful models will work well.

Note: you need 0.4.0 release of ollama to run the llama-vision model https://medium.com/@tapanbabbar/how-to-run-llama-3-2-vision-on-ollama-a-game-changer-for-edge-ai-80cb0e8d8928.
@pdufour thanks for the tip! I'll include this on the README.

> export OPENAI_BASE_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1"
> export OPENAI_API_KEY=fake-key

Got this error:
`openai.InternalServerError: Error code: 500 - {'error': {'message': 'llama runner process has terminated: error:Missing required key: clip.has_text_encoder', 'type': 'api_error', 'param': None, 'code': None}}`

I tried this model: minicpm-v:latest
It works!

You can download pre release
https://github.com/ollama/ollama/releases/tag/v0.4.0-rc8

Just to clarify for the script kiddies out there. The "for model in" part is not able to be used in the windows command promt. I've only figured it out for powershell. So, open powershell.exe and paste this in:

$models = @(
    "claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620",
    "gpt-4o-2024-05-13",
    "gpt-4-turbo-2024-04-09",
    "gpt_4_vision",
    "claude_3_sonnet"
)
foreach ($model in $models) {
    ollama cp x/llama3.2-vision $model
}

How does ollama cp works if I'm running ollama in docker vs ollama installed on host? 
Right now, I have ollama docker setup on different PC on the same network.

For who using Powershell in windows can use script a file extension with .ps1 and run sa administrator to copy model name. but while u use this you need to change sourcemodel full name on ollama list command. 
```Powershell
# Define the models in an array
$models = @(
    "claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620",
    "gpt-4o-2024-05-13",
    "gpt-4-turbo-2024-04-09",
    "gpt_4_vision",
    "claude_3_sonnet"
)

# Define the source model
$sourceModel = "llama3.2-vision:11b-instruct-q8_0"


foreach ($model in $models) {
    Write-Output "Copying $sourceModel to $model..."
    & ollama cp $sourceModel $model
}
```

issues.body: Can anyone share me the steps to host this on my own domain? I am not very much familiar with docker and its deployments.

comments_data.body:
You can use Docker to deploy this. But you can also just deploy it without Docker. The front-end is a simple react app, and the backend is a simple FastAPI Python server. I deployed it on Render for https://screenshottocode.com 

If someone wants to write up more detailed instructions, please do, and I'll add it to the README.
The server keeps crashing on Render
Would Google the error

Its not like that. It boots up and then stops the script
I'll share my configurations
![Web capture_21-12-2023_201047_dashboard render com](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/39786312/375979c3-f4af-4957-b502-8532c8962469)
I'm just saying it's impossible to debug something if you don't share logs.

==> Deploying...
==> Using Node version 20.10.0 (default)
==> Docs on specifying a Node version: https://render.com/docs/node-version
==> Running 'poetry run uvicorn main:app --reload --port 7001'
INFO:     Will watch for changes in these directories: ['/opt/render/project/src']
INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://127.0.0.1:7001/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)
INFO:     Started reloader process [41] using StatReload
ERROR:    Error loading ASGI app. Could not import module "main".
Deploy cancelled
==> Deploying...
==> Using Node version 20.10.0 (default)
==> Docs on specifying a Node version: https://render.com/docs/node-version
==> Running 'poetry run uvicorn main:app --reload --port 7001'
INFO:     Will watch for changes in these directories: ['/opt/render/project/src/backend']
INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://127.0.0.1:7001/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)
INFO:     Started reloader process [43] using StatReload
INFO:     Started server process [47]
INFO:     Waiting for application startup.
INFO:     Application startup complete.
ERROR: Error loading ASGI app. Could not import module "main".
This is my backend deployment on Render env var
Why are you trying to deploy it on Render instead of just running it locally? The docker set up should be easy
> This is my backend deployment on Render > > > env var > > All other fields are default?
Yes, I think so. Make sure root dir is `backend` and then you'd deploy `frontend` separately.
Sure. I am trying it

Build succeeded.

==> Build uploaded in 9s
==> Build successful 🎉
==> Using Node version 20.10.0 (default)
==> Docs on specifying a Node version: https://render.com/docs/node-version
==> Running 'poetry run uvicorn main:app --reload --port 7001'
INFO:     Will watch for changes in these directories: ['/opt/render/project/src']
INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://127.0.0.1:7001/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)
INFO:     Started reloader process [41] using StatReload
ERROR:    Error loading ASGI app. Could not import module "main".


I am having this module missing error.

Everything worked fine.  @abi 
Only the timeout occurs  after 15mins and deployment is automatically cancelled.
Last log is application startup complete

I have used a web service instance on render

Is there any other setting to stop this timeout
This issue is resolved

Going to leave it open so someone can add in a doc with more detailed instructions.

Glad it's solved for you!

Hi all! 

I am using this tool internally at my company (thanks @abi and all the contributors). We are self-hosting and have access locked down to specific folks. Here is a comprehensive guide on how do it securely using Cloudflare on a generic VPS:

https://jonathanadly.com/guide-to-securing-your-self-hosted-open-source-ai-app

(happy to open a PR and put the recipe section somewhere in the docs. Just let me know - because this guide is probably a bit advanced)

issues.title: failed to generate code when uploading a screen recording
issues.body:
1、it will suceed when uploading a screenshot. 
2、it will fail when uploading a screen recording. 
the log from chrome console is as follows:
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/141317425/4e419fb2-2159-476c-a301-942b379a1ccb)
the log from backend service is as follows:
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/141317425/2b0a8e7f-ea04-4f1f-b5a2-e4c6f4b61735)

thanks for your help.

comments_data.body:
@brettyoung6678 how large is your screen recording? And which browser are you using?

That information will be helpful to me in debugging this issue.

browser : chrome  version ：123.0.6312.123（64 bit）
screen recording: 12,545KB
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/141317425/9dc4535f-d05b-4041-accd-4aa3329fadc2)

i can not upload here because of the size limitation of github. i can provide a s3 link if you need.

thanks a lot, @abi

No need for the actual screen recording file. I just wanted to see how large the file was.

I'll check on my end if that should be okay.

One thing you could do is make the file smaller (just use some online compression site) and try it. I think it should work.

Same issue here. When generating screenshots, everything works fine, but whether it's screen recording or uploading local screen files, it fails to generate. The front-end indicates an error in generating the code.

I reviewed the backend logs and found that the system failed to process the video when uploading video files and attempting to generate code. Although the WebSocket connection was successfully established, and the server logs indicated that the code generation process had begun, an error occurred during the video file processing stage. The system tried to parse the video using the MoviePy library but encountered an IndexError with the message "list index out of range". The specific stack trace indicates that this error occurred while trying to read the video file's duration. Here is an excerpt from the error log:

```bash
Exception in ASGI application
OSError: MoviePy error: failed to read the duration of file C:\Users\mywinusername\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpfk6jogim.webm.
Here are the file infos returned by ffmpeg:
```
At the bottom of the error log, there is also an entry stating "`C:\Users\mywinusername\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpfk6jogim.webm: Permission denied,`" indicating that access to this file was denied.

> No need for the actual screen recording file. I just wanted to see how large the file was.
> 
> I'll check on my end if that should be okay.
> 
> One thing you could do is make the file smaller (just use some online compression site) and try it. I think it should work.

Yes, you are right. i can work when i compress the file into a smaller one. thanks a lot.

@brettyoung6678 Awesome, I'll try to make it work for larger files as well. 

@hei2077 thanks for looking at all the logs. There's a problem browser recorded webm videos not including the duration which might be causing this problem. I have to fix this in s2c codebase but can you try recording the video using a different app or taking the recorded video and converting it to MP4. That might fix your problem. The problem could also be with the permissions of the temp directory. Could you try Googling and seeing if there's a fix for this. I'm using the Python tempfile lib: https://docs.python.org/3/library/tempfile.html to store the video before processing.

raise IOError(("MoviePy error: failed to read the duration of file %s.\n"
OSError: MoviePy error: failed to read the duration of file C:\Users\18759\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpg4nfqcmd.mp4.
Here are the file infos returned by ffmpeg:
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/114904966/8b774230-23b9-4e79-8bcd-79a1c19ebea3)
@Herannn are you recording the video in the browser or separately outside the browser and then, dropping it in? The duration failure error should not happen with videos recorded outside the browser.

outside the browser. Below is the backend log.

INFO:     Will watch for changes in these directories: ['E:\\yingyong\\screenshot-to-code\\screenshot-to-code\\backend']
INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://127.0.0.1:7001 (Press CTRL+C to quit)

I had the same issue. Running the following code block in a Python Notebook gave me a detailed message about the error. Then, I realized that I needed more credits or payment methods. After loading some credits using a credit card, it started working 😄

```python
import os
from anthropic import Anthropic
from dotenv import load_dotenv

# Load the .env file
load_dotenv()

client = Anthropic(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("ANTHROPIC_API_KEY"),
)

message = client.messages.create(
    max_tokens=1024,
    messages=[
        {
            "role": "user",
            "content": "Hello, Claude",
        }
    ],
    model="claude-3-opus-20240229",
)
print(message.content)
```

**Error message without credits**
```
BadRequestError: Error code: 400 - {'type': 'error', 'error': {'type': 'invalid_request_error', 'message': 'Your credit balance is too low to access the Anthropic API. Please go to Plans & Billing to upgrade or purchase credits.'}}
```
Thanks for the fix. Will try to fix the project to emit the clearer error.

I just tested a fresh local install with a new Anthropic key and it worked for me so it's probably something specific to your Anthropic account. I know I have no limits on models because I've spent a lot of money with this account.

I will extract the exact header you are using, and insert it in abushoeb script to see what part of it generates the error. I suspect that there is something funky going on with the {"anthropic-beta": "max-tokens-3-5-sonnet-2024-07-15"} part >> I will update

well, i apologize for the fuss, but retrying with the same API key two days later worked w/o me changing any of my configuration. It might have been a delay in key activation on Anthropic side. Thx for the great piece of software!
Awesome!

Hello again! 

Just adding some context here:

I was getting the same error recently, when i turned on `litellm._turn_on_debug()` I realized that litellm was sending the `OPENAI_API_KEY` to the anthropic API instead of the `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY`.

My .env looked like this:
```
MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=<anthropic key>
OPENAI_API_KEY=<openapi key>
```

Removing the `OPENAI_API_KEY` from env did the trick.

issues.title: Add AZURE support
issues.body:
This PR add the support for Azure OpenAI Services (Vision & DALLE-3)

Some considerations:
- Azure parameters are managed only in .env file (not in web interface), I have updated the README file with instructions
- On Azure the vision ad dalle-3 distributions must be in the same reource and same region
- If in .env are present OPENAI and AZURE settings, OPENAI has the priority
- The code probably need some refactor (i am not an high level python developer)

My tests with AZURE are ok, please test also OPENAI

issues.title: Docker deploy failed due to buildkit problem
issues.body:
When I was trying to deploy docker, this happened.

docker-compose up -d --build
[+] Building 34.0s (0/1)
[+] Building 34.0s (0/1)
 => [internal] booting buildkit                                           34.0s
[+] Building 34.2s (1/1) FINISHED
 => ERROR [internal] booting buildkit                                     34.2s
 => => pulling image moby/buildkit:buildx-stable-1                        34.2s
 => => creating container buildx_buildkit_default                          0.0s
[+] Building 34.2s (1/1) FINISHED
 => CANCELED [internal] booting buildkit                                  34.2s
 => => pulling image moby/buildkit:buildx-stable-1                        34.2s
 => => creating container buildx_buildkit_default                          0.0s
Error response from daemon: Conflict. The container name "/buildx_buildkit_default" is already in use by container "8c2af9bd48c75b0ba00bd00eb5b9fdf441669d49390e5a0dd9da21319bc52dc1". You have to remove (or rename) that container to be able to reuse that name.

I've tried a couple of times, and this still happens.

comments_data.body: As the error message says, "You have to remove (or rename) that container to be able to reuse that name." I would try to clear out some of the other containers you have on Docker

> As the error message says, "You have to remove (or rename) that container to be able to reuse that name." I would try to clear out some of the other containers you have on Docker

Do you mean I have to clear out all the containers on my docker? But I only have the container called "zhayujie/chatgpt-on-wechat" and "portainer_agent", nothing else. After the first failed deployment of screenshot-to-code, a container called "buildx_buildkit_default" showed up but not running. When I delete it and then deploy screenshot-to-code again, the same warning message pops up again. It seems that the docker keeps redeploying buildkit again and again, just like a death loop.
the point is why it shows "ERROR [internal] booting buildkit 34.2s" and then it has been cancelled automatically?
Were you able to get this working?

![1701868220288](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/124589551/ddc37141-6c23-4dca-a691-590bc0b4a542)
no, same problem happened.

I deleted the container and the image and rebuilt it again, and then this happened.
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/124589551/ca6e3629-1f26-40a7-8aa7-5bd008b1c25c)
@etfromchina I'm pretty sure it's a networking issue. Maybe, you're not able to connect to Docker Hub servers. Can you check your networking / use a VPN maybe?

I've tried VPN and even different servers, and the same thing happens.
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/124589551/3c4fcf3a-e04e-4312-8181-f8fff03a5d33)
Can you try running it without docker? Or use the hosted version.

> Can you try running it without docker? Or use the hosted version.

Sure, I've tried it without docker, and it worked.
Lol great!
thanks, Abi!

I've finally found the reason why docker didn't work!
BuildKit did something bad about it. So just run the following codes:
```
export DOCKER_BUILDKIT=0
docker-compose up -d
```
Problem solved.

BuildKit is Docker's next-generation build engine that delivers faster, more reliable builds.
If you see the buildx_buildkit_default container already exists error immediately after running the docker-compose up -d command, it may be because BuildKit created this container during the build process but did not delete it in time after the build was completed.
You can try turning off Docker's BuildKit function to see if that solves the problem. BuildKit can be turned off by setting the environment variable DOCKER_BUILDKIT=0.

issues.title: WebSocket Error: Connection Closed 1006 - this worked for me
issues.body:
If you're getting this:
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/108966041/3003b958-6bec-4bf1-9ac4-882421a14407)

Try running the backend with 7001 instead of 7000:

`poetry run uvicorn main:app --reload --port 7001`

comments_data.body:
Thanks! We made the mistake of changing the port after the initial release. 

When did you first clone the repo?

add VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL env, using the ip of your host, here is my example

```
version: '3.3'
  
services:
  backend:
    build:
      context: ./backend
      dockerfile: Dockerfile

    env_file:
      - .env

    # or 
    # environment:
      #- BACKEND_PORT=7001   # if you change the port, make sure to also change the VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL at frontend/.env.local
      # - OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key

    ports:
      - "${BACKEND_PORT:-7001}:${BACKEND_PORT:-7001}"

    command: poetry run uvicorn main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port ${BACKEND_PORT:-7001}

  frontend:
    build:
      context: ./frontend
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    ports:
      - "5173:5173"
    environment:
      - VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL=ws://192.168.17.24:7001
```

I have this error on the online version https://picoapps.xyz/free-tools/screenshot-to-code



![Selection_922](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/4543889/a70e34c4-cd03-4062-a235-fa203b291cdb)
Please try the local version. Not doing support for the hosted version at the moment but will improve it next week.
@abi I cloned it early this morning PDT.
@SystemExecuteLLC hmm.. where was the port 7000 hard-coded? I wonder where we forgot to update.

I experienced this error and also was trying to update VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL but turns out I noticed there's an error in the backend:

```
{'error': {'message': 'The model `gpt-4-vision-preview` does not exist or you do not have access to it. Learn more: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/7102672-how-can-i-access-gpt-4.', 'type': 'invalid_request_error', 'param': None, 'code': 'model_not_found'}}
```

I have not grant the API to GPT-4. According to the [OpenAI documentation](https://help.openai.com/en/articles/7102672-how-can-i-access-gpt-4) you should spent $1 to get access GPT-4 API. I still struggling to get access though.
@fyfirman even after you $1, you still don't have access to GPT-4?
@abi apparently in my case there's a delay about 30 minutes after I paid the bill. But, now I can use it.
Great, I'll add that to the FAQ so people know it might take a few minutes.

> @abi apparently in my case there's a delay about 30 minutes after I paid the bill. But, now I can use it.

can you tell me where to pay it?

@18984955240 1. Open OpenAI Dashboard (https://platform.openai.com/) 2. Go to **Setting > Billing** 3. Click at the **Add payment details** 4. You have to add credits, the minimum is $5. 5. Go to **Settings > Limits** and check at the bottom of the page, you have to be Tier 1 user to get GPT4 access Hope it helps!
@fyfirman thanks for that guide. included it here: https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/blob/main/Troubleshooting.md

> @18984955240 > > 1. Open OpenAI Dashboard (https://platform.openai.com/) > 2. Go to **Setting > Billing** > 3. Click at the **Add payment details** > > 4. You have to add credits, the minimum is $5. 5. Go to **Settings > Limits** and check at the bottom of the page, you have to be Tier 1 user to get GPT4 access > Hope it helps! Thank you very much

No, for screenshots, just OpenAI API key should be okay. Per your logs, it looks like you have the Anthropic key set though. Can you make sure to clear out any keys in the Anthropic section and only keep OpenAI keys?

issues.title: [TypeScript] Found 0 errors. Watching for file changes.
issues.body:
I have deployed it using Docker, but when accessing the backend service, there is a prompt.

`Your backend is running correctly. Please open the front-end URL (default is http://localhost:5173) to use screenshot-to-code.`

Error accessing front-end service as follows：`[TypeScript] Found 0 errors. Watching for file changes.`

comments_data.body:
This looks very confusing. It should be an issue with the lasted version of the vite-plugin-checker plugin:
https://github.com/fi3ework/vite-plugin-checker/issues/238

What happens when you go the front-end URL?

"ERROR" showing up on the front-end logs is harmless and related to what @limboinf mentioned I believe

> What happens when you go the front-end URL?
> 
> "ERROR" showing up on the front-end logs is harmless and related to what @limboinf mentioned I believe

![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/26641387/3a8bd8cf-fea1-4dbe-ae6a-165fb565a432)
This is the error prompt for the front-end.

Can you open up your developer console and show me the logs? 

Or you can use the hosted version at screenshot-to-code.com

> Can you open up your developer console and show me the logs?
> 
> Or you can use the hosted version at screenshot-to-code.com

![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/26641387/7218e718-0772-4617-a96a-d15a2aed679f)

That didn't really help. I think the issue is most likely that your front end isn't connecting to the backend. 

127.0.0.1:7001 opens fine on your browser?

are you running this locally?

> That didn't really help. I think the issue is most likely that your front end isn't connecting to the backend.
> 
> 127.0.0.1:7001 opens fine on your browser?
> 
> are you running this locally?

I deployed it on the server. It cannot be accessed locally using 127.0.0.1:7001, but when using ip:7001, the following prompt is displayed:
`Your backend is running correctly. Please open the front-end URL (default is http://localhost:5173) to use screenshot-to-code.`

Ah that's the problem then. 

The problem is when you access the IP from your local machine, the backend IP you need to use can't be the internal machine IP, it has to be the external IP.

So updated frontend/.env.local:

VITE_WS_BACKEND_URL=ws://..
Yeah if you update it, you need to re build the docker image.

> Yeah if you update it, you need to re build the docker image.

Yes, I have made configuration changes and redeployed the image, but the same error persists.
![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/26641387/1da904bf-28bc-4ef8-8a29-294fbae594cd)
That .env is in frontend, not backend

> That .env is in frontend, not backend
Now it's okay, thank you very much for your help.

issues.title: Investigate open source models
issues.body: This project looks amazing!! Unfortunately I cannot self host it without paying for OpenAI models - is there a possibility that you could look into alternative open-source models utilizing [ggml](https://github.com/ggerganov/ggml) and/or [llama.cpp](https://github.com/ggerganov/llama.cpp)? So far I have found [LLaVa](https://huggingface.co/xzuyn/LLaVa-v1.1-13B-GGML) but I'm not sure if it'd work for this project.

comments_data.body: Yes! definitely would like to support LLaVa. Don't think it's going to be as good but worth supporting. Related: https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/issues/15

if we use open source models, it would be a very "satisfying" feeling that the whole project is independent, and does not have a financial roadblock [to an extent] so yes, what kind of models would be suitable for this?
LLava, CogVLM are worth experimenting with.
Maybe the image processing can be done by LLaVA v1.5, but the code generation can be passed on [DeepSeek Coder](https://github.com/deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-Coder)?

I decided to merge #62 locally and I tried self-hosting the backend/frontend along with llava and `python3 -m llama_cpp.server --model ./2ab9be51b7dc737136b38093316a4d3577d1fb96281f1589adac7841f5b81c43 --clip_model_path ./mmproj.gguf --chat_format llava-1-5 --n_gpu_layers 35`. I specified the openai base url as `http://localhost:8000/v1` and it seems to work 🚀 

The issues I encountered were 
1. I'll have to experiment more but the end result obviously isn't as good as OpenAI/GPT 3/4. 
2. I need a gpu with more VRAM to be able to run larger versions of LLava - 13gb is needed for the larger model and I only have 8gb vram.

nice! can you share some results? screenshot and clone pairs.

also, you could try running llava 13gb with open router: https://openrouter.ai/models/haotian-liu/llava-13b?tab=stats
Also worth trying: https://twitter.com/Teknium1/status/1731369031918293173
Will this work? https://github.com/vikhyat/moondream
we test the effect of cogvlm2 is perfect
when [screenshot-to-code] can support deepseek？
Still waiting for a high quality deepseek model that supports image inputs. R1 doesn't.

> Still waiting for a high quality deepseek model that supports image inputs. R1 doesn't.

deepseek  V3 supports image inputs

I don't have access to the Azure API so I have no way to test it personally. But feel free to submit a PR. 

Going to support https://openrouter.ai in the future
I actually don't think the Azure has the vision model yet.
Looks like they're bringing this to Azure soon: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/ai-azure-ai-services-blog/gpt-4-turbo-with-vision-on-azure-openai-service/ba-p/3979933

i can support u a azure key.
can u support?











Yoh

issues.title: Fix false positive detection by anti-virus software such as Bitdefender
issues.body: ![grafik](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/95778421/886ce46f-7a9c-494b-af25-c992a0ac08cf)

comments_data.body:
Same Issue Here.
It is happing because **clerk.screenshottocode.com** in on **URL Blacklist**.
I can confirm. It's being blocked by Malwarebytes too.
Any idea how to get off this blacklist?
I have no idea. I ran the domain name through some blacklist checkers and they all seem fine.
Mhh maybe contact BitDefender to ask why it's blocked
Yeah I will do that.

I have the same issue.
Is it fixed yet?

![image](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code/assets/68184623/6cd6a9d4-d11b-4572-8d18-88563f34d3a4)
Unfortunately not. I'm not sure how to fix it. Can't you just click "I understand the risks, take me there anyway"?
I think it's on a Blacklist.
I submitted a report to BitDefender and Google Safe browsing today so hopefully, it'll get taken off the blacklist shortly.
Should be fixed now. If someone is still getting blocked by Bitdefender or their anti-virus software, please let me know. Thanks!

issues.title: Hallucination
issues.body:
Describe the bug
When using Screenshot to Code, the generated code output is incorrect/hallucinates and does not accurately match the expected layout and components of the original screenshot. The AI seems to be generating a news website layout instead of a Google Meet interface.

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Go to Screenshot to Code interface
Upload a screenshot of Google Meet interface
Select "HTML + Tailwind" as the generation option
Click "Update" or "Regenerate"
Observe that the generated result shows a news website layout with articles about "Israeli Military Raids" and "Las Vegas Weddings" instead of the Google Meet interface components
Screenshots of backend AND frontend terminal logs
From the provided screenshot, we can see:

Input: Google Meet interface screenshot showing a video call interface with control buttons and a participant
Output: Incorrectly generated layout showing a news website with unrelated content
The generation settings show "HTML + Tailwind" is selected
No terminal logs are visible in the provided screenshot to help debug the issue
Additional notes:

This appears to be a model hallucination issue where the AI is not correctly interpreting the input screenshot
The generated layout is completely different from the source material (Google Meet interface)
The issue seems to be with the model's interpretation rather than a technical error, as the generation process completes but produces incorrect results
![CleanShot 2024-12-02 at 00 57 12@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d13ca3ae-9583-41f9-b185-e66c8f5f918b)

comments_data.body: Do you have the SHOULD_MOCK_AI_RESPONSE env variable set in your backend .env file?  The response here is a mock response that is used for testing during development.
No, I've only made a git clone of this repo and followed the README instructions.

@lionelcoding I'll look into this. Can you share your .env after taking out the keys?

You can also go into the config.py in backend and change the SHOULD_MOCK_AI_RESPONSE = line to "SHOULD_MOCK_AI_RESPONSE=False". Let me know if that works.

Should_mock_AI_RESPONSE was already on False.

![CleanShot 2024-12-02 at 16 23 34@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f2440a12-90b9-4021-a9fe-4a77d346381f)

@abi here my content into .env file 

`OPENAI_API_KEY=xxxxxx
`
Thanks
Change the line to "SHOULD_MOCK_AI_RESPONSE=False" and see it helps.
It works thanks. I touched the Anthropic SDK integration in llm.py as well.
@lionelcoding how did you modify llm.py?
I'm pretty surprised you ran into this because it shouldn't happen unless the env var is set.
@abi sorry I mean I noticed the Anthropic package is missing. I've only run the poetry add anthropic@latest command in my terminal.

issues.title: Support for react/vue/svelte?
issues.body:
I've been ~wasting money for fun~ testing the project with some websites and it's really interesting. But right now, besides doing quick mockups, I see little applicability in real-life scenarios since raw HTML doesn't provide a workflow where you can easily compose with structures, parse information from a request and what not

**Are there any plans on giving support for any of the major front-end frameworks? (Vue, React, Svelte...)**

I wonder if it could be as simple as asking the model to then parse the output HTML into something else. Or, if on the other hand, there would be an advantage at directly asking the model to refactor code on the fly to create a more optimal structure...

comments_data.body: Yes, it should be relatively simple and we do plan to add that in the future.

First of all, are you using a transit or direct connection?  Second, check whether the key is normal.  1006 does not necessarily mean that the backend cannot be connected, and if the api address is connected incorrectly, an error of 1006 will be reported.  Finally, if you are using transit, you need to add /v1.

> First of all, are you using a transit or direct connection? Second, check whether the key is normal. 1006 does not necessarily mean that the backend cannot be connected, and if the api address is connected incorrectly, an error of 1006 will be reported. Finally, if you are using transit, you need to add /v1.

I am using a transit connection, and I have configured OPENAI_BASE_URL=https://xxxx/v1 and the key, but it still prompts error code 1006. When I don't add the /v1 suffix, it gives error 1000, and there are no errors reported, but the file I receive contains no content.

> > 首先，您使用的是中转还是直达？其次，检查按键是否正常。1006并不一定意味着后端无法连接，如果api地址连接错误，会报1006的错误。最后，如果您使用的是中转，则需要添加/v1。

issues.title: Accessing openai.ChatCompletion, no longer supported in openai>=1.0.0 - how to update the code to use the new API? (AZURE)
issues.body:
I'm using Azure API keys.


The error in backend logs indicates that the [openai.ChatCompletion] API has been removed in [openai>=1.0.0]. 

You need to update your code to use the new API.

You tried to access openai.ChatCompletion, but this is no longer supported in openai>=1.0.0 - see the README at https://github.com/openai/openai-python for the API.

You can run `openai migrate` to automatically upgrade your codebase to use the 1.0.0 interface. 

Alternatively, you can pin your installation to the old version, e.g. `pip install openai==0.28`

A detailed migration guide is available here: https://github.com/openai/openai-python/discussions/742

Cheers

Apologies @Marcelfoxion - been really busy and forgot to reply!

I have just pushed my (rather hacky) changes here: https://github.com/ashsmith88/screenshot-to-code/tree/quick-branch

The branch works with Azure, but also has additional changes as I have got it to do a 2nd request with OpenAI to get the code in react which I can use as a template in my development - so you are probably only interested in some of the backend changes. 

From the Azure point of view, I added an env arg: `USE_AZURE=True` and then put my Azure keys into the two args:

```
OPENAI_API_KEY=
OPENAI_BASE_URL=

```
in config.py
```
USE_AZURE = os.environ.get("USE_AZURE", False)
```

The updated this function to look like this:

```
async def stream_openai_response(
    messages: List[ChatCompletionMessageParam],
    api_key: str,
    base_url: str | None,
    callback: Callable[[str], Awaitable[None]],
    model: Llm,
) -> Completion:
    start_time = time.time()
    if USE_AZURE: # <--- Imported from config
        client = AsyncAzureOpenAI(api_key=api_key, azure_endpoint=base_url, api_version="2024-08-01-preview")
        params = {
            "model": "gpt-4o", 
            "messages": messages,
            "timeout": 600,
        }
    else:
        client = AsyncOpenAI(api_key=api_key, base_url=base_url)
        params = {
            "model": model.value,
            "messages": messages,
            "timeout": 600,
        }
```

You will obviously need to make sure you have an Azure deployment and update anything above (i.e. I have hard coded my model as wasn't worried)

This isn't a production ready fix at all, but works perfectly for me when using locally.

comments_data.body: which model are you using on ollama and does it support multi modal imports?
llama3.2-vision:11b

> " httpcore.ConnectError: All connection attempts"

I think it's not able to connect to Llama? We don't directly support ollama but I think if you use the OpenAI compatible endpoint, it should work.
What is the name of the model requested for this project?
Use OpenAI, Claude or Gemini.
I have the same problem, how to solve it?

> Use OpenAI, Claude or Gemini.

I mean the model name of the post request, such as “GPT4-turbo” or “llama3”

me,too. how to solve it?

backend
Your API key is not valid
I followed the step by step instructions on how to get the chatgtp4 api, adding the 5 dollars but I still can't get a correct api
Your error indicates that it's trying to use Claude. Which env vars did you set? If you set the OpenAI one then it shouldn't try to use Claude.

I've found my mistake, thank you very much. I was confusing the lines
echo "ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your-key" > .env

docs: update images-in-update-history.md to reflect current implementation

- Change status from 'implementation plan' to '✅ IMPLEMENTED'

- Remove outdated code examples since feature is already implemented

refactor: remove redundant test_prompts.py from prompts directory

The prompts/test_prompts.py file contained outdated unit tests for low-level
prompt assembly functions that are already comprehensively covered by the
integration tests in tests/test_prompts.py and tests/test_prompts_additional.py.

Benefits:
- Eliminates test duplication and maintenance burden
- Removes hardcoded system prompt constants that can become stale
- Focuses testing on the main test suite with proper mocking and async support

- Update all tests to match simplified prompt structure

fix: update all tests to use new create_prompt function signature

- Update all test calls to use individual parameters instead of legacy dict params
- Add asyncio_mode = auto to pytest.ini for proper async test support
- Ensure all tests pass with the new typed parameter interface
- Maintain test coverage for all prompt creation scenarios

Tests updated:
- test_prompts.py: 10 test methods updated
- test_prompts_additional.py: 3 test methods updated

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

refactor: improve create_prompt architecture to use extracted params with clean separation

- Extend ExtractedParams with prompt creation fields: prompt, history, is_imported_from_code, result_image
- Refactor create_prompt to accept individual typed parameters instead of raw dict or ExtractedParams object
- Update PromptCreationStage to extract specific parameters from ExtractedParams and pass them individually
- Remove dependency on context.params in favor of context.extracted_params throughout prompt creation pipeline
- Achieve cleaner separation of concerns between parameter extraction and prompt creation logic

Benefits:
- Type safety: All prompt parameters are properly typed
- Isolation: create_prompt function is completely decoupled from application structure
- Testability: Easier to unit test with specific parameters
- Maintainability: Clear interface showing exactly what prompt creation needs

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

- Add comprehensive type annotations throughout test_prompts.py:

  - Class constants with proper types (TEST_STACK: Stack)
  - Mock dictionaries with explicit types
- Create ExpectedResult TypedDict using actual OpenAI ChatCompletionMessageParam types
- Fix assert_structure_match function with proper type annotations
- Resolve IDE vs terminal type checking discrepancies

All tests pass with enhanced type safety while maintaining readability.

Add URL normalization to screenshot endpoint

Automatically add https:// protocol to URLs without a scheme and validate
that only http/https protocols are accepted. This improves UX by handling
common URL formats like "example.com" without requiring users to type the
full protocol.
